title: Workshop for Developing Collaborative Dialogue-Based Instructional Methods (IC) Using Online Teacher Communities of Practice (CoP)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematics Education Experience and Adaptability to Online Learning Environments
context.additional_context: Comprises working professionals (administrative/managerial) engaged in practice-oriented learning using BYOD simulation/VR tools. Operates with summative assessments and strengthens instructional design competencies through learning community activities.

learning_goals: Learners apply collaborative dialogue-based instructional methods (IC) in an online Community of Practice (CoP) to improve math lesson design.
Learners develop lesson scenarios applying core principles of IC pedagogy (considering cultural and linguistic diversity) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners derive instructional improvement strategies by sharing knowledge and feedback with peer teachers through CoP activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
